titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The worst thing that I know about Byron is the very unfavourable impression which he made on men, who certainly were not inclined to judge him harshly, & who, as far as I know, were never personally ill–used by him. Sharp & Rogers both speak of him as an unpleasant, affected, splenatic person. I have heard hundreds & thousands of people who never saw him rant about him: but
I never heard a single expression of fondness for him fall from the lips of any of those who knew him well.
